intro: Clematis vanhouttei, commonly known as the Van Houtte’s Clematis, is a deciduous vine native to China. It is characterized by its vigorous growth and showy, fragrant flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant produces large, white to pale blue flowers with a distinctive, slightly wavy corolla. Its leaves are compound, consisting of three to five oval-shaped leaflets. Clematis vanhouttei thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
